name: resegregation
content:

the process of becoming, or causing a something to become, segregated (= keeping people separate or treating them differently according to race, sex, religion, etc.) again: Allowing students to attend the schools closest to them has resulted in wholesale resegregation by race and income levels. Re-segregation has left classrooms as racially divided as they were at the height of the civil rights movement.
